clinical_study.brief_title: Development and Validation of the Patient-completed Caprini Risk Score
clinical_study.official_title: Patient-Completed Caprini Risk Score for Venous Thromboembolism Risk Assessment Developed and Validated From 1017 Medical and Surgical Patients: a Diagnostic Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to test the reliability and validity of the Chinese version of patient-completed CRS in hospitalized patients and to evaluate whether this form can be widely used in clinical practice instead of only health care workers' evaluation.

primary_outcome.measure: Question-to-question agreement between patient-completed and nurse-completed CRS
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will use kappa value to compare the question-to-question agreement level between nurse and patient-completed Caprini Risk Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation and difference between the scores calculated by patient-completed and nurse-completed CRS
secondary_outcome.description: The Spearman correlation coefficient was used to measure the correlation and difference between patient-completed and nurse-completed CRS.

intervention.description: The participants will be asked to complete patient-completed Caprini Risk Score

study_pop.textblock: The investigators will recruite nearly 500 inpatients from the surgical unit and nearly 500 inpatients from the medical unit between January 1 and December 31, 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients older than 18 years
- patients with first admission to the medical and surgical units within 24 hours
- willingness to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with a diagnosis of PTE or DVT on admission
- patients with cognitive impairment
- inability to read or write
- patients with mental diseases
- patients with visual impairment
- refusal to cooperate

responsible_party.investigator_title: Deputy Director of the Second Department of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine in China-Japan Friendship Hospital
